abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Adaptation to Climate Change in Arid and Semi-Arid Lands
            (KACCAL) Project for Kenya is to improve the ability of
            participating districts and communities in the Arid and
            Semi-Arid Lands (ASAL) to plan and implement climate change
            adaptation measures. There are three components to the
            project. The first component of the project is climate
            information products, policy, and advocacy. This component
            will strengthen capacities among national institutions to
            better assess and respond to current and future climate
            risks. It will generate and disseminate climate-related
            knowledge and strengthen institutional coordination among
            currently fragmented agencies managing disaster and climate
            risk. National stakeholders will be trained to further
            disseminate the knowledge that is generated to the district
            and community levels. The second component of the project is
            climate risk management at the district level. This
            component will promote the integration of a climate risk
            management perspective into district planning processes and
            programs. The component will build capacity related to
            climate change among major stakeholders at the district
            level and support public and private climate-smart
            investments. The third component of the project is
            community-driven initiatives for climate resilience. This
            component will help communities to adopt climate change
            adaptation strategies and investments. It will complement
            Arid Lands Resource Management Project (ALRMP)/ASAL
            Sector-Wide Approach (SWAp) activities in reducing
            vulnerability among the ASAL population by directly
            strengthening their resilience to climate risk.
